page.title: 01Rural life in N.E. Leics.
page.content: This quiet rural area has many farms and four small villages, Scalford, Wycomb, Chadwell and Goadby Marwood. {Scalford,}a conservation village is the largest, and has the only church dedicated to St. Egelwin in the country.{Goadby Marwood}has large fishponds, a church and a chapel. {Chadwell}and{Wycomb}are very small. Houses in the area are mainly made of ironstone or an old local brick,many having been renovated in recent years by newcomers to the area. Patterns of work have changed considerably in the past few years. Though farming is still the most important industry,few adults earn their living on the land.Many people travel to work in nearby towns and cities, yet find their community life in the villages.
